Accept autosuggestion and keep cursor in place. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:auto_suggest.accept_and_keep_cursor`

Accept autosuggestion and move cursor left in place. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:auto_suggest.accept_and_move_cursor_left`

Apply autosuggestion or jump to end of line. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:auto_suggest.accept_or_jump_to_end`

column2:
Insert a newline after the cursor indented appropriately. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:shortcuts.newline_autoindent`

Control-N in vi edit mode on readline is history previous, unlike default prompt toolkit. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:shortcuts.next_history_or_next_completion`

Open code from input in external editor. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:shortcuts.open_input_in_editor`

Control-P in vi edit mode on readline is history next, unlike default prompt toolkit. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:shortcuts.previous_history_or_previous_completion`

Quit application with ``SIGQUIT`` if supported or ``sys.exit`` otherwise. :raw-html:`
` `IPython:shortcuts.quit`

Key binding handler for readline-style tab completion. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:completion.display_completions_like_readline`

Kills the word before point, using "not a letter nor a digit" as a word boundary. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.backward_kill_word`

Kills the word before point, using "not a letter nor a digit" as a word boundary. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.backward_kill_word`

Move back to the start of the current or previous word. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.backward_word`

Move to the start of the current line. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.beginning_of_line`

Invoke an editor on the current command line, and accept the result. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.edit_and_execute`

Invoke an editor on the current command line, and accept the result. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.edit_and_execute`

Invoke an editor on the current command line, and accept the result. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.edit_and_execute`

Invoke an editor on the current command line, and accept the result. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.edit_and_execute`

Kill the text from the cursor to the end of the line. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.kill_line`

Kill from point to the end of the current word, or if between words, to the end of the next word. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.kill_word`

Like `yank_nth_arg`, but if no argument has been given, yank the last word of each line. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.yank_last_arg`

Rotate the kill ring, and yank the new top. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:named_commands.yank_pop`

Accept input when enter has been pressed. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:prompt._accept_input`

Exit when Control-D has been pressed. :raw-html:`
` `prompt_toolkit:prompt._eof`

` `prompt_toolkit:prompt._keyboard_interrupt`
